quality_check_questions.thinking_process: The golden halo around Mary is a core iconographic feature distinguishing her as a holy figure in Christian art. It is a universally recognized symbol of divinity and must remain present regardless of artistic style. In the original image, it is a simple circular gold ring above her head. Even in a Renaissance fresco, this halo must be preserved in form and position to maintain identification. Losing it would make her indistinguishable from other figures.

This specific object is not just decorative but symbolic. In the original image, it extends upward from his hand. Any transformation must retain this object in his grasp, even if rendered in fresco style. Removing or altering it would misrepresent his identity.
